metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1325 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in Clmg, where with the help of a maliciously crafted pandore or bmp file with modified dx and dy header field values it is possible to trick the application into allocating huge buffer sizes like 64 Gigabyte upon reading the file from disk or from a virtual buffer.

criterions.comment: cimg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
